intro: Delphinium staminosum, commonly known as the slender larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers have five petals, with the lower petal being spurred, a characteristic feature of the delphinium genus. Delphinium staminosum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is also known for its toxicity to livestock.
